request_templates.name: Alabama Standard Records Request
request_templates.description: General purpose records request for Alabama state agencies
request_templates.template_text:
Dear Records Custodian:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Act, Alabama Code §§ 36-12-40 through 36-12-46, I respectfully request access to and copies of the following public records:

[SPECIFY RECORDS REQUESTED]

I am an Alabama resident as required by state law. If you determine that some portions of these records are exempt from disclosure, please provide me with the non-exempt portions and cite the specific statutory authority for any withholdings.

Per Alabama Code § 36-12-44, please acknowledge receipt of this request within three business days and provide a substantive response within the applicable timeframe (15 business days for standard requests or 45 business days for time-intensive requests).

If you anticipate charging fees for this request, please notify me in advance of the estimated costs. I understand that fees are limited to actual reproduction costs, with a maximum of $1 per page for the first 50 pages and $0.50 per page thereafter.

If you deny any portion of this request, please provide written explanation of the specific statutory authority for the denial.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
[REQUESTER NAME]
[ADDRESS]
[CITY, STATE ZIP]
[PHONE NUMBER]
[EMAIL ADDRESS]
[DATE]

request_templates.name: Alabama Executive Agency Records Request
request_templates.description: Specific template for executive agencies with enhanced deadline requirements
request_templates.template_text:
Dear Records Custodian:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Act, Alabama Code §§ 36-12-40 through 36-12-46, I respectfully request access to and copies of the following public records:

[SPECIFY RECORDS REQUESTED]

I am an Alabama resident as required by state law. This request is submitted to an executive agency as defined in Alabama Code § 36-12-44(a)(1).

Please acknowledge receipt of this request within three business days as required by Alabama Code § 36-12-44(c) or (d). Please categorize this request as either a standard request (can be completed within 8 hours) or time-intensive request and provide substantive response within the applicable timeframe:

• Standard Request: 15 business days
• Time-Intensive Request: 45 business days (may be extended to maximum 180 business days or 270 calendar days)

If some portions of these records are exempt from disclosure, please provide the non-exempt portions and cite specific statutory authority for any withholdings.

If you anticipate charging fees, please notify me in advance. I understand fees are limited to actual reproduction costs ($1 per page for first 50 pages, $0.50 thereafter) and that payment may be required before substantive response for time-intensive requests.

Failure to respond within applicable timeframes will be treated as denial of this request per Alabama Code § 36-12-44(f).

Thank you for your compliance with Alabama transparency law.

Sincerely,
[REQUESTER NAME]
[ADDRESS - MUST BE ALABAMA]
[CITY, STATE ZIP]
[PHONE NUMBER]
[EMAIL ADDRESS]
[DATE]

request_templates.name: Alabama Records Denial Appeal Notice
request_templates.description: Notice template for pursuing judicial review of denied records request
request_templates.template_text:
Dear Agency Counsel:

This letter serves as formal notice that I intend to pursue judicial review of your agency's denial of my public records request dated [REQUEST DATE] and denied on [DENIAL DATE].

Alabama's Open Records Act does not provide for administrative appeals. Therefore, I am providing you this opportunity to reconsider your denial before I file a lawsuit in circuit court as authorized by Alabama law.

The requested records are public records subject to disclosure under Alabama Code §§ 36-12-40 through 36-12-46. Your cited exemptions do not apply because [EXPLAIN WHY EXEMPTIONS DON'T APPLY].

I request that you:
1. Reverse your denial decision
2. Provide the requested records within 10 business days
3. If partial denial is maintained, provide detailed justification citing specific statutory authority

If you do not reverse your decision, I will proceed with filing a lawsuit in circuit court within the two-year statute of limitations to compel disclosure of these public records.

I prefer to resolve this matter cooperatively rather than through litigation.

Sincerely,
[REQUESTER NAME]
[ADDRESS]
[CITY, STATE ZIP]
[PHONE NUMBER]
[EMAIL ADDRESS]
[DATE]

CC: [AGENCY HEAD]
    [ATTORNEY GENERAL'S OFFICE IF APPLICABLE]
